page.title: 07PANGBOURNE A - 1
page.content: Pangbourne is an attractive Thames-side village. {Library:} The library was built in 1974 on a spot where once stood a fire-station (the new fire-station is in Horseshoe Road); it replaced a small room in the old Town Hall. The Library has 10 000 books and 3 300 members; Saturday mornings are most busy. A record of missing books is kept. Exhibitions are held regularly. {Combined Infant and Junior School:} There are 160 junior and primary pupils and 90 infants. The teachers number 12. The school dinners cost 65p for a set menu for all children. Educational trips are a part of the curriculum; a BBC computer is used by the Junior pupils.
